description:
Vash the Stampede’s a joyful gunslinging pacifist, so why does he have a $6 million bounty on his head? That’s what’s puzzling rookie reporter Meryl Stryfe and her jaded veteran partner when looking into the vigilante only to find someone who hates blood. But their investigation turns out to uncover something heinous—his evil twin brother, Millions Knives.

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: トライガン スタンピード

tags.name: Full CGI
tags.description: Almost entirely created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Desert
tags.description: Prominently features a desert environment.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Aliens
tags.description: Prominently features extraterrestrial lifeforms.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Steampunk
tags.description: Prominently features technology and designs inspired by 19th-century industrial steam-powered machinery.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

node.description:
Yasuhiro Nightow is a Japanese manga artist and game creator who created the anime and manga Trigun. Nightow was born in Yokohama, Japan. He moved to Yokosuka when he was in elementary school, and spent the junior high and high school years in Shizuoka.

Before the release of the popular manga, Trigun, Nightow studied social science and then majored in media studies. Nightow became popular in the US thanks to the US release of Trigun. Trigun, the TV series, had a limited broadcast run in 1998.

Nightow also created the characters and story for the Sega/Red Entertainment anime and third-person shooter video game series Gungrave.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nightow)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/114958993) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/koujitajima/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/KoujiTajima) | [ArtStation](https://www.artstation.com/koujitajima)

Japanese concept artist living in Vancouver, Canada.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/114958993) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/koujitajima/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/KoujiTajima) | [ArtStation](https://www.artstation.com/koujitajima)

Japanese concept artist living in Vancouver, Canada.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/binobinobi) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/押山清高)

Co-founder and Representative Director of [Studio Durian](https://anilist.co/studio/6283/).

The founder and CEO of Studio ORANGE. He began as freelance CG creator in the game industry, before switching to anime with 'Zoids: Chaotic Century‘ in 1999. Founded Studio ORANGE in 2004 after working on Shoji Kawamori's 'Aquarion'. He has worked as a 3D/CGI Director and/or Producer for shows from Madhouse, Xebec, Doga Kobo, Kinema Citrus, and Passione.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yujikaneko)

Founder and representative director of Aoshashin.

[Blog](http://hiroshisaito.net/blog/)

_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/190604/)._
